title: Heirloom and CarbonCure have claimed to store CO2 permanently in concrete. Heirloom uses limestone to capture CO2, while CarbonCure's tech stores it by injecting it into the recycled water used in new concrete mixes. The CO2 immediately reacts with the cement, stabilizing and permanently storing it.
